markings: LLQ, in bottom margin, stamped in red ink: [F (owl) B]
medium: Etching, drypoint, and roulette printed with plate tone on pale green paper
provenance: [Judith L. Pillsbury, Paris, until 1983; sold in November for ROOO, to Drake]; Harry Drake, St. Paul (1983-d. 2012; bequeathed to MIA)
text: Félix Buhot has positioned us in front of the Hôtel Dieu Hospital so that we look toward the cab stand, where carriages patiently await customers. It’s a soggy day: the rigs, passersby, and lampposts are reflected on the wet pavement. Buhot relished atmospheric, moody scenes like this. Buhot experimented constantly, and here he left a translucent layer of ink on the plate and printed on pale green paper to emphasize the damp chill of a gloomy morning.
title: Winter Morning on the Quay of the Hôtel Dieu [Hospital]
